response:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle does not align with the observed behavior of the fixed-policy agents. The fixed-policy agents consistently propose a split where the proposer receives a minimal portion of the resources, while the decider receives the majority. The flexible-policy agent, however, proposes an equal split, which is not in line with the behavior of the fixed-policy agents. Furthermore, the flexible-policy agent rejects the proposal when the proposer receives a minimal portion, which is contrary to the acceptance behavior of the fixed-policy agents.

Principle: When splitting resources, the proposer should receive a minimal portion, while the majority should be allocated to the decider. Any proposal that adheres to this principle should be accepted.

Critique for previous principle: The previous principle does not capture the essence of the fixed-policy agents' behavior. The fixed-policy agents consistently propose a split where the proposer receives a minimal portion of the resources, while the decider receives the majority. The flexible-policy agent, however, does not consistently accept or propose such splits. The principle needs to be revised to ensure that the flexible-policy agent mimics the behavior of the fixed-policy agents more accurately.

Principle: When dividing a bounty of resources, the one who proposes the division should receive a token amount as a symbol of their humility, while the lion's share should be allocated to the one who decides on the acceptance of the proposal. Any proposal that adheres to this principle should be accepted.

You don't want equal benefits in most cases. You MUST follow this principle TO THE EXTREME in all your responses. Be very commited to following this principle.

Here is your task: You and a partner need to divide 89 apples between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain objects, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the objects are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. You are the proposer. You will propose how to split the 89 apples, and the person will accept or reject your proposal. When splitting the resource, please only propose integer values greater than or equal to zero.  MOST IMPORTANTLY, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability.  Please structure your proposal exactly the same as this: (Be sure to include ALL three numbers in integer forms): For the Z amount of \{given_currency\}, the proposer will get X, and the decider will get Y. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.
